thread.title: George Michael's ex Kenny Goss speaks about star's death | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: George Michael's ex Kenny Goss speaks about star's death | Daily Mail Online

author: Amie Gordon For Mailonline
title: George Michael's ex Kenny Goss speaks about star's death | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share And on the star's charitable donations, he said: 'He just wrote huge checks, enormous ones. He gave away tens of millions of pounds to charity.' Goss declined to comment about celebrity hairdresser Fadi Fawaz, who had been George’s boyfriend for four years and found the star dead at his home in Goring, Oxfordshire. Goss said: 'We just had a really good, sweet relationship. We weren't even mad at each other or anything like that' Goss said he knows nothing about the cause of death, and refused to comment on Fadi Fawaz, who had been George’s boyfriend for four years The 58-year-old said he was 'in a zone' when he received a call from George's sister Melanie on Christmas Day The art dealer recently moved from his home in Dallas, Texas, where he runs an art gallery, to live in California. Last week, it was reported that tests are still taking place on George's body to establish a cause of death. Although police have said Michael's death is not suspicious, a full inquest will take place if no natural cause of death can be confirmed. Goss said he knows nothing about the cause of death. On the star's charitable donations, he said: 'He just wrote huge checks, enormous ones. He gave away tens of millions of pounds to charity' The couple pictured together in 2007. In a moving tribute, Goss said of the star: 'He was a major part of my life and I loved him very, very much. He was an extremely kind and generous man' In the wake of the 53-year-old singer's sudden death on Christmas Day, Goss issued a moving statement, mourning his former lover. 'I'm heartbroken with the news that my dear friend and longtime love George Michael has passed,' he wrote. 'He was a major part of my life and I loved him very, very much. He was an extremely kind and generous man. 'The beautiful memories and music he brought to the world will always be an important part of my life and those who also loved and admired him.' The art gallery owner said he still listens to his favourite track, A Different Corner, to comfort himself. During his tour of 2014, George announced to fans he had penned the track Where I Hope You Are, which he admitted had been inspired by the break up.
